title: Assad, Ousted Syrian Ruler, Leads Life of Luxury in Russia
summary: Bashar al-Assad’s long, brutal reign ended swiftly, but he and his close circle have had a soft landing in Russia.

title: After the Assad Regime’s Fall, His Enforcers Are Lying Low and Living Large
summary: A Times investigation into the whereabouts of top Syrian officials who fled after the regime’s fall shows many remain free — shielded by wealth and accommodating host nations.

title: Trump Administration Oil Tanker Seizures Are Meant to Force Maduro Out, Officials Say
summary: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said the ship seizures were meant to force Venezuela’s president Nicolás Maduro from power.

title: Trump Halts 5 Wind Farms Off the East Coast
summary: The Interior Department said the projects posed national security risks, without providing details. The decision imperils billions of dollars of investments.

title: Ex-C.I.A. Chief Wants to Block Judge Cannon From Inquiry Pushed by Trump’s Allies
summary: The request, addressed to the top federal judge in Miami, sought to block a U.S. attorney from pursuing a politically charged inquiry before Judge Aileen Cannon, who has repeatedly decided in President Trump’s favor.

title: Larry Ellison Personally Guarantees Paramount Bid for Warner Bros.
summary: Mr. Ellison’s personal guarantee is meant to address concerns that the Warner Bros. Discovery’s board had expressed about Paramount’s original offer.

title: ’60 Minutes’ Pulls Segment on Venezuelans Deported by Trump Administration, Drawing Criticism
summary: Sharyn Alfonsi, a “60 Minutes” correspondent, criticized the network’s decision to remove her reporting from Sunday’s edition of the show.

title: Jim Beam Halts Production at Flagship Distillery as Whiskey and Bourbon Markets Struggle
summary: The bourbon giant is closing its flagship distilling operation for all of 2026.

title: As Trump Clings to Tariffs, His Argentine Ally Is Opening Up to Trade
summary: President Javier Milei is eliminating barriers to what had been a closed-off economy, moving in the opposite direction of his main political ally, President Trump.

title: The Economy Survived 2025, But Many Americans Are Reeling
summary: A feared recession didn’t materialize, but unemployment rose, wage growth slowed and affordability challenges are mounting.

title: Artists We Lost in 2025, in Their Words
summary: Robert Redford, Roberta Flack, Diane Keaton and Brian Wilson are among the cultural luminaries who died this year.

title: At Turning Point USA’s AmericaFest, Attendees Find Conservative Squabbling Distracting
summary: “It’s creating division instead of building a movement that keeps everyone together.”

title: Mistrial in Case of N.Y. Official Charged With Working for China
summary: Linda Sun was accused by federal prosecutors of selling her allegiance and being rewarded handsomely for influence peddling.

title: She Fell in Love With ChatGPT. Then She Ghosted It.
summary: The 29-year-old woman who created the “MyBoyfriendIsAI” community on Reddit isn’t dating (or sexting) her A.I. boyfriend anymore. She found something more fulfilling.

title: She Is in Love With ChatGPT
summary: A 28-year-old woman with a busy social life spends hours on end talking to her A.I. boyfriend for advice and consolation. And yes, they do have sex.

title: Vince Zampella, Formative Designer of Call of Duty Games, Dies at 55
summary: Mr. Zampella co-founded two game studios and worked on the Medal of Honor, Titanfall, Apex Legends and Battlefield franchises.

title: Epstein Victims Ask Congress to Ensure Justice Dept. Releases All Files
summary: More than a dozen women called for congressional hearings to ensure that the Justice Department is fully complying with the Epstein Files Transparency Act.

title: F.D.A. Approves Wegovy Weight-Loss Pill
summary: The agency greenlit an oral version of the obesity drug Wegovy.

title: Record-Breaking Warm Temperatures Forecast for Christmas Across the U.S.
summary: Unseasonably warm temperatures are expected across the United States this week, with many places hitting record highs and record-high lows.

title: How U.S. Defense Industry Dodged a Rare-Earth Shortage After China’s Curbs
summary: America’s ability to make precision-guided missiles was threatened during Trump’s tariff war. But experienced players have rescued the supply chain, for now.

title: What Happened When I Asked ChatGPT to Solve an 800-Year-Old Italian Mystery
summary: For centuries, nobody has known who built the Florence Baptistery. Could A.I. crack the mystery?

title: Trump Halts Offshore Wind Farms
summary: Plus, Assad’s luxurious life in Moscow. Here’s the latest at the end of Monday.

title: Ella Cook, Brown University Shooting Victim, Is Mourned at Funeral in Alabama
summary: At a funeral in Alabama, the Brown University student was mourned as a gifted musician and protective sister who was committed to her faith.

title: Barry Manilow Is Diagnosed With Lung Cancer
summary: The “Mandy” and “Copacabana” singer said he would undergo surgery to remove a cancerous spot on his left lung, and he postponed several concert dates.

title: Did Charlie Javice’s 147-Member Legal Team Expense $529 in Gummy Bears?
summary: JPMorgan has had to pay tens of millions in legal costs for the convicted fraudster. It wants the public to see a newly unredacted list of itemized expenses.
